subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A building and plumbing or drainage installation must be constructed using materials, products, plumbing products, forms of construction and designs fit for their intended purpose to achieve the relevant requirements of the NCC.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: For the purposes of (1), a material, product, plumbing product, form of construction or design is fit for purpose if it is—

ol.li:
supported by evidence of suitability in accordance with—
A5G2; and
A5G3 or A5G4 as appropriate; and
constructed or installed in an appropriate manner.

callout.p: A5G1 relates to the quality of work and materials needed to construct a building to meet NCC requirements.

ul.li: all people involved with construction must work skillfully in accordance with good trade practice; and
all materials must be of a quality to fulfil their function/s within the building.

callout.p: A5G1 only applies to matters normally covered by the NCC.
While A5G1 outlines quality of work and material demands, sometimes additional conditions may be required by—

ul.li: other Commonwealth, State or Territory legislation; and
contracts that include either specific quality requirements, or requirements for specific materials and the like.

callout.title: Example
callout.p: Permit authorities would ordinarily not apply A5G1 to such matters as—

ul.li: plastering — other than for fire rating, waterproofing of wet areas, and sound insulation; or
painting — other than that required for weatherproofing an external wall.

callout.p: When determining which form of evidence will be used, it is important to consider the appropriateness of the evidence, as some forms of evidence may be more suitable to materials and products and others to designs and forms of construction. The requirement to consider appropriateness of the evidence is specified in A5G2(1).
